title.narrative: 2.3 PRE PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Critical bottlenecks are addressed to ensure gender equity at pre-primary, primary, and secondary levels of education, which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable participation in and completion of quality, inclusive education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Critical bottlenecks are addressed to ensure gender equity at pre-primary, primary, and secondary levels of education

description.narrative: UNICEF increased access to quality pre-primary education by constructing new pre-primary centers and continuing to partner with MINEDUC on improving the quality and availability of teaching and learning materials. UNICEF also supported the Government to advocate for increased budget allocation to the sub-sector. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/10/2018

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Early learning - ECD facilitators/teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF

actual.value: 2016: 2,203 pre-primary teachers were trained on ECE and the pre-primary competency-based curriculum, with the support of UNICEF.
